decks.notes: The main focus of this deck is to quickly assemble the combo of Ad Nauseam and Angel's Grace to draw the entire deck and then win the game with Laboratory Maniac. The deck uses a combination of fast mana generation with cards like Lotus Bloom and Pentad Prism, while also running protection in the form of Pact of Negation. The goal is to reach the critical mass of cards needed to win in a single turn, usually through a series of cantrips like Serum Visions and Sleight of Hand.

The main strategy of this deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with low-cost artifacts and creatures. By combining cards that boost the power and toughness of artifacts like Cranial Plating and Steel Overseer, the deck can deal out significant damage very quickly. Additionally, cards like Inkmoth Nexus can provide an alternate win condition by turning into a flying infect creature. The deck aims to be aggressive and efficient, using cards like Signal Pest and Vault Skirge to chip away at the opponent's life total while maintaining a strong board presence.

This aggressive Affinity deck relies heavily on artifacts, utilizing efficient creatures like Ornithopter, Signal Pest, and Arcbound Ravager to quickly deal damage to the opponent. The deck also includes key cards like Galvanic Blast and Cranial Plating to enhance combat abilities and close out games. With cards like Mox Opal and Springleaf Drum helping to ramp out threats early, the deck is able to apply consistent pressure and overwhelm opponents quickly. Inkmoth Nexus provides an alternate win condition if necessary, making the deck versatile and difficult to disrupt.

The deck focuses on assembling a variety of creatures that work together to create a powerful combination that allows for flexibility and adaptability. By utilizing cards like Chord of Calling and Collected Company to search for specific creatures, the deck can quickly find the pieces it needs to execute its game plan. Key creatures like Melira, Sylvok Outcast and Anafenza, Kin-Tree Spirit work in tandem to disrupt opponent strategies, while cards like Kitchen Finks and Viscera Seer provide additional utility and value. The deck aims to out-value opponents through its toolbox of creatures and combo potential.

This deck focuses on utilizing a toolbox of creatures to combo off and generate value. By using cards like Collected Company and Chord of Calling, players can search for key creatures like Kitchen Finks, Melira, Sylvok Outcast, and Murderous Redcap to create infinite combos or disrupt opponents' strategies. The deck also includes cards like Voice of Resurgence and Wall of Roots to protect against control decks, while cards like Eternal Witness and Reclamation Sage provide additional value and utility. The goal is to outvalue opponents while assembling powerful combos to secure the win.

The deck focuses on assembling a variety of creatures that can be tutored onto the battlefield using cards like Collected Company and Chord of Calling, creating a toolbox of options to disrupt the opponent's strategy or protect your own. By utilizing creatures with abilities like persist, exiling other creatures, and preventing -1/-1 counters, the deck aims to out-value the opponent and control the board while setting up for a combo finish involving cards like Melira, Sylvok Outcast and Murderous Redcap. It synergizes well with mana dorks like Birds of Paradise and Noble Hierarch to ramp into its powerful plays.

This deck focuses on quickly summoning powerful Eldrazi creatures to overwhelm the opponent and deal massive amounts of damage in a short period of time. By utilizing cards like Eldrazi Mimic and Vile Aggregate to buff up the creatures, combined with Eldrazi Temple and Eye of Ugin to ramp up mana production, the deck aims to consistently bring out big threats like Reality Smasher and Thought-Knot Seer early in the game. With a mix of aggression and versatility, this deck can put pressure on the opponent and secure victories swiftly.

The main focus of this Modern Eldrazi Aggro deck is to quickly deploy powerful Eldrazi creatures and disrupt opponents with cards like Chalice of the Void and Warping Wail. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with large creatures like Reality Smasher and Thought-Knot Seer while utilizing cards like Mutagenic Growth and Simian Spirit Guide to maintain pressure. The mana base of Eldrazi Temple, Eye of Ugin, and Urborg, Tomb of Yawgmoth allows for fast and efficient mana production to consistently cast threats early in the game. Additionally, cards like Ratchet Bomb and Ghost Quarter provide additional disruption against opposing strategies.

This Modern 1 vs 1 deck focuses on controlling the board and outlasting opponents with a combination of removal spells, protective enchantments, and powerful creatures like Sun Titan and Gideon Jura. The deck aims to consistently clear the board with cards like Day of Judgment and Wrath of God, while also disrupting opponents' strategies with cards like Runed Halo and Ghostly Prison. The deck's win condition comes from recurring threats like Kitchen Finks and Wall of Omens with Emeria, the Sky Ruin, while also utilizing land destruction with Ghost Quarter to gain advantage.

The main concept of this deck is to assemble the UrzaTron lands (Urza's Mine, Urza's Power Plant, and Urza's Tower) to produce a large amount of mana quickly. This allows the player to cast powerful colorless spells like Karn Liberated, Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger, and Wurmcoil Engine, while also using control elements like Pyroclasm, Spellskite, and Oblivion Stone to disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck focuses on mana ramp, control, and powerful late-game threats to overwhelm the opponent and secure victory.

The deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly and controlling the opponent's plays until it can combo off with Scapeshift to deal lethal damage with Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle. It utilizes a variety of counterspells and removal spells to disrupt the opponent's game plan, while also including tutors like Bring to Light to search for key combo pieces. The deck aims to stall the game until it can assemble the necessary cards to win in one explosive turn, using the landfall triggers from Valakut to burn the opponent out.

This deck focuses on controlling the board through removal spells and counter magic while utilizing powerful creatures like Geist of Saint Traft and Dragonlord Ojutai to apply pressure and close out the game. It also includes versatile cards like Snapcaster Mage and Restoration Angel to provide flexibility in different situations. The mana base is designed to support all three colors (Blue, White, Red) efficiently, allowing for the deck to access a wide range of spells and threats throughout the game. The inclusion of Celestial Colonnade adds a powerful win condition that can quickly take over the game.
